text: Tridrepana olivacea is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Warren in 1922. It is found in New Guinea, extending to Goodenough Island and the Bismarck Archipelago.The Hooktips (Drepanidae, Drepaninae) of Papua Indonesia The wingspan is about 34–41 mm for males and about 44.5 mm for females. ==Subspecies== *Tridrepana olivacea olivacea *Tridrepana olivacea crocata Watson, 1957 (Rook Island and New Britain) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1922 Category:Drepaninae
title: Tridrepana olivacea
